goal.ch:
課程目標：
「依照部定範圍規劃，盡量包含以下議題，性別平等、人權、環境、海洋、品德、生命、法治、科技、資訊、能源、安全、防災、家庭教育、生涯規劃、多元文化、閱讀素養、戶外教育、國際教育、原住民族教育及其他新興議題等各類教育議題，並依當前教育趨勢及教育現場需求適時調整。」並依照新聞時事，安排閱讀素材與上課討論，讓學生能跟上教育現場的脈動。
 
課程進行方式：
　　原則上，教師會邀請相關演講或準備相關影音資料，上課時帶領學生討論。接近學期末的幾周，為小組專題時間，小組需要在課程時間依據演講的內容，決定主題，針對主題進行深度探索，並將資料綜合整理成期末教案。期待學生們應用多元教學策略、教學媒材及學習科技，以促進有效學習。
接近學期末的幾周，為小組專題時間，小組需要在課程時間完成期末教案。
goal.en:
**Course Objectives:**  
“In accordance with the government-mandated curriculum, this course aims to encompass topics such as gender equality, human rights, environment, marine education, ethics, life education, rule of law, technology, information, energy, safety, disaster prevention, family education, career planning, multiculturalism, reading literacy, outdoor education, international education, Indigenous education, and other emerging educational issues. These topics will be adapted based on current educational trends and classroom needs.“ Additionally, reading materials and class discussions will be arranged based on current news and events to help students stay attuned to the dynamics of educational practice.  

**Course Format:**  
The instructor will generally invite guest speakers or prepare relevant audiovisual materials and guide students in class discussions. During the final weeks of the semester, students will work on group projects. Groups are required to determine a topic based on the content of the guest lectures, conduct in-depth exploration of the topic, and compile their findings into a final teaching plan.  

Students are expected to apply diverse teaching strategies, instructional materials, and learning technologies to promote effective learning. The final weeks of the semester are dedicated to group projects, during which groups must complete their final teaching plans during class time.
